text: [Music]
Francis Bacon Francis
Bacon
um was going through London one day and
uh it was there was snow lying on the
ground and uh he stepped down from his
carriage and asked a woman
in the house for a chicken slaughtered
the chicken and he then began to proceed
to stuff the chicken with with snow
because he had this idea that snow could
perhaps refrigerate animal flesh
brilliant idea you the refrigerator 300
years 400 years before it was invented
as a consequence of this he caught a
cold but and he was some distance from
home so he went to the house of a local
Aristocrat friend only in Chelsea
somewhere but the the the bed was down
um and uh the cold turned into pneumonia
and he died of the effects of that maybe
the worst the worst example of course is
is is Jean jaac Russo I mean Russo who
um unlike Obama has written two
autobiographies
Russo uh wrote three so Obama still got
time to catch up and surpass Russo but
in the last of the autobiographies he
talks about um uh one of the walks he
was on
and he was on this long walk out of
Paris and as he was coming back into
Paris uh a carriage was coming up the
the hill with a huge Masti dog running
alongside of it the dog crashed into
rousong threw him to the ground he lost
Consciousness he regained Consciousness
some some hours some hours later blood
was running out of of his mouth he was
horribly disfigured and
bruised and he said that the first
sentiment he felt at that point was calm
was a complete sense of joy and and uh
and sort of contentment with with
existence uh which is strange he goes
back home he survives for another two
years but some of his biographers think
that he died of the effects of the
cerebral damage caused by um caused by
this collision with the dog but this is
this is the kicker uh stories then began
to circulate around Paris that Russo had
in fact died uh and they even got to the
king and queen of France and they they
believed that he died and his uh
obituaries began to appear in the Press
which were overwhelmingly negative and
um even a sale an auction of Russo's
manuscripts which entirely fallacious
was announced in the Press so Russo was
the only philosopher I know who as it
were died posthumously right he he he
died he lived to experience the effects
of his own death and of course it made
him very
sad
